campaign.story:
The Startup Kids is a documentary about young web entrepreneurs in the U.S. and Europe. It contains interviews with the founders of Vimeo, Soundcloud, PlayFish, Wordpress, Posterous and many others who talk about how they started their company and their lives as an entrepreneur. The documentary also compares the different environments, resources and attitudes of entrepreneurs on either side of the Atlantic. 
Who are we?
We are two Icelandic girls, Sesselja and Vala, who founded our first company in 2009, shortly after the economic collapse of Iceland. Along with editing our documentary we are now working on our new startup, KinWins.com. 
We wanted to motivate other young people to go into entrepreneurship so we grabbed a video camera and bought ourselves a one way ticket to the United States. We traveled to New York and San Francisco and met lots of amazing people along the way. 
We came in to contact with everything from young people starting out for the first time with their office in their bedroom at their parents house, to successful entrepreneurs sitting in an office with a view over the San Francisco skyline. 
Of course we also had all kinds of adventures along the way. Getting lost in the New York subway system, getting questioned by the Google Police for trying to sneak into the Google cafeteria on a food hunt (who knew that they have their own police force wearing intimidating Google uniforms) and sweating through an interview after doing a marathon sprint across Central Park to get there on time. 
In Europe we traveled to London, Berlin, Stockholm and Copenhagen. The adventures continued. Late night parties with the crazy London start-up people, an embarrassing moment when a little language misunderstanding made us think we were speakers not bloggers at a conference in Stockholm and when we were suddenly elevated to the roles of rockstars during a Berlin start-up brunch.
Overall we met some amazing and inspirational people and have around 70 interviews to put together in a feature length documentary. Here's a list of all the interviews recorded in the U.S. and Europe. 
Why Kickstarter?
We got a grant from the “Youth in Action” program, which is an European Union fund. The grant covered our travels and the filming. We need additional funding to finish post-production as well as funds for promoting and premiering the film.
Follow us:
Our website , On Twitter ,  On Facebook

campaign.story:
People want to see Homeward Bound meets a zombie apocalypse, they just don’t know it yet.
The Play Dead TRAILER is NOW UP!!!
--------->  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2nF4m-agoyk  <---------
Thanks for your support, and welcome to the Play Dead Kickstarter page.
A zombie apocalypse unites a ragtag pack of dogs in the ruined streets of Miami. Immune to the epidemic, they must stick together to survive in the midst of ferocious undead and human survivors. Sit. Stay. Play dead...
We are a group of local filmmakers in Miami commissioned by the Borscht Film Festival (www.Borscht.info) to write and shoot a short film that tells a unique Miami story. We’ve always been influenced by the roller coaster thrills of a good horror movie and the classic storytelling themes repeated in some of our favorite Disney films. We finally decided to blend those two concepts together, and what came out of it is our most ambitious project to date: Play Dead.
Zombies roam the streets in the days and nights following a horrific new virus which is wreaking havoc in Miami. Pitched gun battles and burning streets provide a backdrop for a ragtag band of dogs who are determined to survive.
Below are a few production stills of what we've shot so far!
WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT to make this film a reality. BORSCHT has pledged their support by providing us with an initial budget. But we need your $3,000.00+ dollars to make this film BIG! Seriously, LIKE HUGE!!!
I'm sure you're asking yourself, "What are they going to do with my money?" Well, let me tell you. We are going to turn the streets of Miami into an apocalyptic doggie playground! When you walk into the theater you'll be thinking of Miami as sex, drugs, and Reggaeton. When you walk out of that theater after the Play Dead screening, all that will come to mind when you think of sunny Miami is blood, guts, and doggie treats. This, my friends is what your much-appreciated donations will be purchasing. That, and some of the really cool collector's items and VIP privileges offered to you on this page. Please check them out and donate to our epic cause.
BORCHT's 2011 commissioned films are teaming up filmmakers with musicians. For Play Dead, BORSCHT is teaming up filmmakers Andres and Diego Meza-Valdes with musicians Rachel Goodrich and Amigo the Devil. Two wicked cool musicians for two wicked cool directors.
The BORSCHT Film Festival is a recipient of the John S. and James L. Knight Foundation Arts Challenge Grant.
To watch a trailer for the Meza-Valdes Brothers previous works: http://www.youtube.com/watch...
For music from Rachel Goodrich: http://www.myspace.com/rachelgoodrich
For music from Amigo the Devil: http://www.myspace.com/amigothedevilmusic
To watch more amazingness from The BORSCHT Film Festival: http://vimeo.com/14165824
And now...A special message from Werner Herzog...
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f1WkKnjjYCE

campaign.story:
Moviesandbox is an Open-Source, Real-Time 3D Animation tool. It allows you to quickly sketch and animate 3D Characters and Props. Its focus is on ease of use and modularity. The idea is that you can simply draw objects in 3D space and animate them later on with the built in timeline.
--- a sketched character in Moviesandbox ---
You can also script puppeteering and camera behaviour using a graphical scripting system. And in addition, Moviesandbox can receive data from outside applications allowing MIDI-Controllers, Kinect sensors, Milkscanners and Arduino hacks to control all aspects of your animation in real-time!
---MSB running on a Mac during a workshop, with live Arduino input from Processing ---
It also comes with a lot of cross-platform tools that help you create content, like the Milkscanner or an audio input tool that let's you lipsync your characters to microphone input.
IMPORTANT!
Please, as much as I would like to have you help me, have a look at the Minimum System requirements below before you make a donation. While I feel confident in creating a stable animation software, I am no magician and I cannot make it run on computers that aren't funky enough for OpenGL.
MINIMUM SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS:
OS: Windows XP or later // Mac OS 10.5 or later // Ubuntu 10.04 or later. Graphics: OpenGL 2.0 compatible Graphics card (GeForce 7, ATI/AMD X1600 or higher). Memory: 2GB.
With that out of the way, let's talk about why I want your help:
I have been working on this software for quite a while, starting at my 2008 Fellowship at Eyebeam Art and Technology Center and there's a pre-release version out that you can download at www.moviesandbox.net.
I would like to spend two months of work to turn it into a tool that a lot of people can use and play around with. This is where you come in! Your money will allow me to work full-time on the software to iron out the useability issues, squash bugs and create lots of documentation and video tutorials, so you know how everything works.
--- an example scene from an early version of the tool---
During the duration of this Kickstarter project, I'll start producing a short animated movie to both illustrate what the software is capable of and to thoroughly test its current state, so I can get to work on adding necessary features and polishing the software once funding is finished (and the two months of work begin). So if you are unsure if Moviesandbox is for you, check back in the updates section to see where I am going with it.

campaign.story:
With over 600 million users and a valuation of over $70 billion, Facebook is the world's dominant social networking platform. What are the challenges a social media company of this size will face? What are the strategic moves it should make? How can Facebook users take advantage of the platform and its increasingly rich social graph?
These are the questions we are addressing with the Future of Facebook video series. Using the STEEP forecasting methodology, we’ll be viewing the challenges and opportunities for this company through the lenses of Society, Technology, Environment, Economics, and Politics. Each of these five categories will become a short focus video that fleshes out that topic area. The final video will be a big picture overview of the potential pathways for the evolution of Facebook.
Interviews are still underway, but here’s a look at who we’ve talked to so far: 
David Armano - SVP, Edelman Digital
Stowe Boyd - futurist, social technologies blogger
Jamais Cascio - ethical futurist, Senior Fellow of the IEET
Amber Case - co-founder Geoloqi
Suzanne Fischer - Curator of Technology, The Henry Ford
Garry Golden - energy and emerging markets futurist
Alex Howard - Government 2.0 Correspondent for O’Reilly Media
Kevin Kelly - author, What Technology Wants; founding editor, Wired Magazine
Brett King - author, BANK 2.0
Rita J King - Innovator-in-Residence IBM Analytics Virtual Center
David Kirkpatrick - author, The Facebook Effect
Valdis Krebs - founder, Orgnet; network analysis expert
Richard MacManus - founder, ReadWriteWeb
Om Malik - founder, Giga Omni Media
Eghosa Omoigui - Venture Capital & Private Equity
Howard Rheingold - author, Smart Mobs
Douglas Rushkoff - author, Program or Be Programmed
Doc Searls - author, Cluetrain Manifesto
David Siegel - author, Pull
John Smart - President, Accelerating Studies Foundation
Scott Smith - founder, Changeist
Nova Spivack - founder, Lucid Ventures
Sibley Verbeck - founder, The Electric Sheep Company
This project is being assembled according to a process we’re developing called Open Foresight, which aims to serve as an updated model for harvesting collective insight, generating scenarios, and creating strategic roadmaps into the future. By combining available data, opinions from the experts, and the conventional wisdom of the crowds, we’ll be able to analyze a topic from a wide range of perspectives and viewpoints. We’ll then distill that down into a series of animation-rich videos that summarize these insights. All of the content we collect will be made available via Creative Commons SA by-cc so that it can be reused, remixed, and built upon by others.
To launch the public arm of the project, we've posted the same 15 questions we asked all interviewees onto Quora. We'll be monitoring the topic for the most insightful and provocative answers you've got. The people with our favorite answers will be invited to participate in an interview with us for inclusion in one of the final videos. You can add your vision to "The Future of Facebook" topic page here: http://www.quora.com/The-Future-of-Facebook-Project
Your donation will help us cover editing, animation, and other critical production costs.
We hope this will be the first of many upcoming foresight projects that teach us to better harness our collective ability to understand complex issues in a way that’s open, collaborative, and fun!

campaign.story:
WHAT'S THE PLAN?
The plan is simple. We are going to make an amazing film, which is both aesthetically gorgeous, compelling in story, and stunning in both written and spoken dialog.
Once we finish the film, we are going to seek both distribution and theatrical success to get the cast and crew placed firmly on the map in an acknowledgement of their collected talents.
WHAT'S IT ABOUT?
Villanelle is "Horror-Noir" in it's purest sense. What exactly does that mean? Well, "Horror-Noir" is a genre that combines the grit, feel, and snappy dialog of a Mickey Spillane type detective drama, and combines it with the suspense, terror, and supernatural elements that used to make horror so much fun! In this sense, it revitalizes and holds true to two time tested genres.
Villanelle tells the story of a hard drinking but honorable, down on his luck detective, Travis Burke, who after a storied career taking down high profile criminals in Boston, has an, "indiscretion", and gets exiled to the township of New Shoreham, where he's made Chief of Police. Old habits die hard for Chief Burke, who is pulled back into his old school sense of justice when he's approached by Dawn, a beautiful creature who's been attacked, and left for dead.
WHAT DO WE NEED TO MAKE VILLANELLE?
Well, to be perfectly honest, we need money. Film making is expensive if you want to do it right. Villanelle is no exception. First of all, we have an amazing cast and crew (both professionals and awesome friends who are donating their time to the project). Secondly, we couldn't ask for better locations than the ones we already have in place (We got REALLY lucky). The main backdrop and principle base of locations is New Shoreham, RI, also known as Block Island.
Unlike Rhode Island, Block island is an actual island. The only way to reach it is by ferry, and let me tell you, it's not cheap when you need to get a full cast and crew out there four or five times. Beyond that, there are the costs of additional equipment to make our camera guys lives easier, and the finished product amazing. We are shooting on the Canon 7D, which is a film quality camera, but needs some bells and whistles in order to tap it's full potential.
Costs on films, even ones made for little money, can spiral out of control if you aren't realistic. We've attempted to come up with the realistic breakdown, but there's always something you miss.
Here's a breakdown of what your donations are going towards...
** Ferry Fees for Cast and Crew ** Color Correction and Visual Effects ** Food and Beverages ** Professional Sound Mixing ** Musical Score and Soundtrack ** Camera Accessories ** Practical Effects ** Gas Money for the Cast and Crew ** Festival Fees
SO WAIT. WHY USE KICKSTARTER?
Simply because Kickstarter represents the exact way we want to make our films; Supported by friends, family, and lovers of film. Totally independent of studios. Grass roots based, with local talent both on screen, and behind the action. In the end, we get the type of movie we want to go see in theater, and watch over again.
IS ANYBODY GONNA SEE HOW MUCH I DONATE?
Just us! And our lips are sealed!
OK. I'VE DONATED. WHEN DO I GET MY DONATION INCENTIVES?
Well. Incentives are only sent if we reach our goal. With your help we can. Once the goal is reached, we make the movie. Incentives will start flying out the door between the start and end of production (A DVD is a good example. We gotta finish the movie before we send it to you) However, our crack team of Donation Updaters will get to work the second our goal is reached, and keep you posted the whole ride through.
CAN WE EXCEED OUR TARGETED GOAL??
Yes, yes and yes! Once we reach our goal, you can continue to donate, and let's face it, the more money, the better. Additional funds will go towards things like better editing and coloring services, better sound mixing, and things of that ilk. the more the merrier!
WHAT HAPPENS IF THE MONEY ISN'T RAISED IN TIME?
No one gets anything and no money is exchanged. Meaning we don't get to live our dream, you don't get to be part of something awesome, and it turns into a really boring situation. I don't think we should collectively allow this to happen!
SO, DO YOU HAVE A WEBSITE?
It's in development. Our Art department is working their tails off and quite frankly, hasn't got around to it. We plan to launch the site by the start of production. In the meantime, here'a a link to our Facebook group where you can see the stars of the film, read a little something about it, and stay up to date on press for the film!
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Villanelle/196433450371791

campaign.story:
"Gilgamesh" is a story set in 2100 BC. in Sumer, nowadays southern Iraq.
Gilgamesh, two thirds god and one third human, is faced by his worst fears. His one and only friend, Enkidu, falls sick. Their long-time friendship finally comes to an end. Enkidu dies and leaves behind him Gilgamesh to live with sorrow for the rest of his life. Gilgamesh refuses to let Enkidu go, and his grief takes him to an impossible journey.
This story is part of a greater epic called the Epic of Gilgamesh. It is believed that it's the oldest literature in history and is, unbelievably, still relevant to our lives nowadays.
"Gilgamesh" will be a three minute visual narrative depicting the last moments of friendship between Gilgamesh and Enkidu.
This film is my thesis project for Columbia College. It will be shot on 35 mm film using full Arri BL III camera package.
Most of the budget will go to costumes, props, set construction, food, transportation, and film processing and HD transfer. I'm putting the rest of the costs from my pocket.
The costumes will be brought from Syria for greater authenticity. The film score (Soundtrack) will be composed in Syria based on and inspired by ancient Mesopotamian melodies.
The film will be shot in a museum for 3 days in April.
The story of Gilgamesh has been my favorite since my childhood. Having the chance now to make it into a movie is a dream come true.

*SHIPPING DOMESTIC+INTERNATIONAL IS INCLUDED FOR REWARDS*
*ORIGINAL SCORE FOR THE FEATURE WILL BE COMPOSED BY C418*
*PICTURES OF REWARDS CAN BE FOUND IN THE UPDATES SECTION*
The video above only contains the first 6 minutes of the piece. To view the full 20-minute short for free, please visit Gametrailers.com.
THE BEGINNING: Over the past year, the computer game Minecraft has become a cultural phenomenon, drawing millions of players into the unique, low-res world created solely by Swedish programmer Markus "Notch" Persson. When Persson announced that he would invest his Minecraft earnings in founding his own development house, Mojang Specifications, 2 Player Productions seized upon the rare opportunity to fly to Sweden and document the first week in the life of the new studio.
During the editing process of what was only supposed to be a twenty-minute short, it became clear that an important chapter of gaming history was still being written, and that a feature-length documentary about Mojang's first year would make a powerful statement about what it means to create, release, and play games in the twenty-first century.
THE FILM: For the first time, viewers will be given an in-depth look at both the triumphs and the challenges faced by a studio during their first year in existence. We will analyze the unprecedented success of Minecraft, gain insight into its impact from journalists and industry professionals, and meet the fans whose lives have been changed by the game.
“Minecraft: The Story of Mojang” would represent 2 Player Productions’ second foray into feature films (following 2008’s critically-acclaimed “Reformat the Planet”) and is part of our ongoing mission to examine and celebrate the zeitgeist of contemporary gaming culture.
THE PLAN: Your investment will allow us to make frequent visits to the Mojang office in Sweden and other locations around the globe throughout 2011. Support would also allow us to enrich the film by hiring additional crew to handle post-production effects, audio engineering, an original musical score, and the production and shipment of unique Backer rewards. To incentivize donations, we are reuniting with merchandising team Fangamer to produce a wide variety of exciting products -- all of them exclusive to this four-week campaign period.
Throughout the production, we’ll maintain a project blog about the film’s progress and post plenty of photos and bonus videos. The film is set to be released in 2012 (provided the world doesn’t end) and will ship out on an exhaustive 2-disc DVD set.
Thank you for your support! 2 Player Productions
To view the full 20-minute short, please visit Gametrailers.com.
*SHIPPING DOMESTIC+INTERNATIONAL IS INCLUDED FOR REWARDS*

campaign.story:
"Moder And His One Iota" is a short film combining stop motion, claymation, and rotoscope animation. It tells the story of a not too distant future where there has been a harsh economic down turn. The 'everyman' of our story; Moder, has been out of work for quite some time and is waiting for a solution to come along his way. He puts his faith in the government to fix his life-- when just that happens: in the form of a job stimulus plan for the American people. Moder gets handed a new job at a new factory... yet; the work, the results, and the effects are not what anyone had in mind. Dramatic, hysterically funny, and still poignant: the story of Moder is an important one for our times.
The process for "Moder" will be the most elaborate I have ever undertaken for an animated short film. It was previously not possible to take the next step creatively because of a lack of resources, which, you can help change. We will be filming completely original live action for our animation sequences, designing elaborate matte paintings for backgrounds, and sculpting original puppets for the claymation sequences. All of these materials, and processes can be extremely expensive, however, thanks to an integrated process originated by Jimi Patterson and the help of state of the art equipment; the process has been streamlined and made incredibly independent in nature. What used to take a team of animators will now be done by one. The 2,200 is a relatively small fee when considering the elements.
The short film is a criticism of the faith people put in big government to solve their problems. It's also a criticism of what it actually means to create according to ability, yet take according to need. The hope of this film is to inspire debate about what the role of government really is in society, and most importantly, ask the question: what should individuals hold as their highest value while working? Does doing a job that you love, mean you'll never work a day in your life? It seems today people are ready to sacrifice them selves to any and all causes without any moral principal involved-- is this a good or bad thing? Ultimately the film is suppose to spur debate, and celebrate the lost art of 2D animation.
Note to prospective. donors: If you are considering a contribution for my artistic endeavor, I would like to state that no individual should feel any obligation to donate on any grounds other than voluntary intent to see the film made. As incentive to donate there are 'rewards,' which are negotiable (if a donor has an idea for a reward that I have not included, this can be discussed via email.) I only encourage donations if the donor is in a position of financial comfortability. If you can't pay your rent, or your phone bill, please do not consider donating, I 100% understand your situation. However, if you are in a position to donate, and looking for a capable artist in need of monetary support to realize an important achievement, by all means, click donate now and make a $500 contribution. Thanks so much for taking the time to read about my project, and I hope to get this film off the ground, into festivals, and out to as many people as possible.

campaign.story:
Chasing after a young troublemaker who carries a box full of pigeons, an old man struggles to recover his friends trapped within.
Struggling with PTSD, he loses his grasp on what is real and what isn't and continues to be haunted by his wartime experiences in Vietnam.
His rescue mission leads him to a restaurant, where he will confront the monster within himself, as well as a horrible creature that offers redemption in an unlikely way.
We're hoping to raise $1,500 for this short film over the course of the next month. This project will be the most ambitious film I have undertaken and represents the culmination of my college career. We are blessed to have so many talented individuals helping to produce this film, volunteering time and money as cast and crew. We all believe in this film and are asking for your support to get it off the page and onto the screen.
The money raised will go directly to production costs: feeding the cast and crew, wardrobe and prop rentals, location fees, and the creation of the "horrible creature." All money raised over my goal will go towards festival fees so that this film can be seen all over the US and internationally.
We've put together a great list of gifts in return for your generous support. From posters, DVD copies, and even walk-on parts in the film! We want to include you in this filmmaking experience.
Please join us in getting this film made. We can't do it without your support. Pass it along to your friends as well. We only have 30 days to reach our goal. Thank you very much!

updates.update_content:
We wrapped our two days of shooting (very late) last night, and now we put on our editors' hats. 
I will be collecting information for sending out kickstarter rewards for supporters in the next few days. The T-shirts, posters, and dvds obviously come later, but copies of the script and production stills should be coming out very shortly.

With 7 days to spare, we reached our goal! Thank you everyone for making this happen. 
With the 1,500 we can produce the film as envisioned and do it justice, but any additional donations are more than welcome and will go towards props, wardrobe, lunch and festival submission fees.
Thank-you gifts will be developed just after principal photography wraps. And 7 days from now I'll be getting your mailing info so I can send out DVDs, shirts, and posters.

Lots of contributions of all sizes and we've nearly hit our goal. A big thank you to all the friends of this project! It's energizing to have this kind of support.
My FX artist has some media of the creature to come. Hopefully I can get it up on the site by Thursday for another sneak peek.

A sneak peek of the monster, mid-sculpt. About the size of a pig. It's missing it's jaw, but the body structure is lovely, and terrible all at once. Moulding, painting, robotics to follow. Stay tuned for more peeks.
The project just launched and in under an hour we have already been found by interested backers! Many thanks to everyone who contributes and helps me to produce this film.

campaign.story:
WHAT ARE WE DOING? A feature-length documentary about the life and career of famed special effects make-up artist Tom Savini. Know as the "King of Splatter", Tom's work revolutionized an industry with such movies as Friday the 13th, Creepshow, and Dawn of the Dead. But these facts are mere misdirection, as the film delves into Tom's personal triumphs and failings, revealing the man behind the mask.
The documentary features interviews with Academy Award winning special effects make-up artists Greg Nicotero and Howard Berger of KNB EFX, Video Watchdog founder and film critic Tim Lucas, The Misfits' Jerry Only, and legendary filmmaker George A. Romero.
WHERE IS YOUR MONEY GOING? While Tom Savini has been and continues to be supportive of the project, the film has primarily been self financed. Much of the documentary is in the can, and the money raised here will go towards travel expenses for additional interviews outside the Pittsburgh area. Part of it will also go towards equipment rentals and other expendables.
THANK YOU! I've spent the past year of my life on this project, and we're beginning the home stretch. Tom is not just the film's subject, he's also become my friend, and I want others to come to know him as I have.
Thank you for taking the time to view our project and trailer. We have some great incentives for those who wish to donate. And if you cannot donate at this time, please refer others to us.

campaign.story:
The Paper Prince is a story about the young and unusual friendship between Emile and Arthur.
THE SYNOPSIS
Arthur is a young boy who tries to spend his days wandering around, exploring what interests him. Unfortunately, most of his attempts to go outside in the world generally result in injury. For a boy made of paper, he is especially and predictably delicate. This greatly hinders his ability to make friends.
Emile is a dance prodigy and spends most hours of the day in the studio. His ballet company prepares for an upcoming production, and Emile pushes himself to the limit practicing.
By chance, Arthur gets a glimpse of Emile dancing and becomes irrevocably fascinated by his skill and drive. When Emile injures his leg, the two become close friends. Arthur stays with Emile in the hospital, and after Emile recovers, he tries to show Arthur that the world can be a safe and exciting place.
However, the boys learn that not everyone is ready to accept Arthur, and in the end, Emile must make a dramatic decision about how much their friendship means to him.
THE PROJECT
The Paper Prince will be a short film shot on Super 16mm (or 16mm, TBD) thanks to an amazing donation from KODAK and the Dodge College of Film and Media Arts. Due to the fact that it is my final thesis project, the school will also be providing all of the equipment for free. Therefore, I am very grateful to have the opportunity to pursue and finish this project by the end of spring.
As for Arthur specifically, I am hoping to make a larger-than-life-size, realistic paper head for an actor to wear. I will also make paper hands so that Arthur will appear to be made entirely from paper. With computer graphics added in post-production, Arthur will have responsive facial expressions, and cinematically, will be a living, active character (who happens to be made from paper).
THE PEOPLE
I'm lucky to have so many talented people also involved in this project. Please look them up because they're all unbearably gifted! :)
SPECIAL EFFECTS ARTIST : Andrew Finch 3D ARTIST : Matt Vana SOUND DESIGN : Andrew Swanson aka St. Andrew MUSIC COMPOSER : Daniel Kaufman aka Plant Magic Man COLORIST : Greg Cotten PRODUCER : Ossie Kishlanski CINEMATOGRAPHER : Jordan Black EDITOR : Sean Shao Chi Yap PRODUCTION DESIGN : Joseph Carnegie SCRIPT SUPERVISOR : Natalie Walters CHOREOGRAPHERS : Zak Ryan Schlegel and Jamie Donovan
THE FINANCES
I am funding most of this film myself (with the money I have happily set away since high school). The total cost will be about $5000. Half of the funding will go towards bringing Arthur to life. It will pay for the digital effects team as well as the 3D artist modeling the paper head. The rest will go towards paying for locations and paying the set teacher (with child actors, safety is especially important, next to fun and games).
THE REWARDS
Your support, literally, means everything because without it, everything about this project would not exist. Please take a look at the rewards offered (to the right), and hopefully you'll find something that interests you (beyond just the project). I am also open to suggestions, so if there is something you especially want out of supporting this project, please let me know! :)
KICKSTARTER (and why you might/might not care)
Kickstarter allows for an amazing opportunity and platform to not only reach people potentially interested in The Paper Prince but also to support other great artists and creators. If you have any questions about Kickstarter, please go here : https://www.kickstarter.com/help/faq
Kickstarter allows for all-or-nothing funding, so if The Paper Prince does not reach its goal in time, you won't be charged. It is a great way to get people to be involved and excited about this project.
If this is a story you're interested in and would want to see succeed as a film, I happily (and gratefully) invite you to be a part of the process.
I am excited to do all that I can to make this project happen, and with your support, I have no doubts that it will.
Thank you so much for everything (especially for reading until this point).

campaign.story:
Synopsis: "HIBAKUSHA" is an animated documentary/drama featuring Kaz Suyeishi, an 84 year old woman, who recalls her most vivid and horrific experiences as an 18 year old Japanese American student during the morning of August 6, 1945 when the atomic bomb dropped on her hometown.
Steve Nguyen (Fast and the Furious 3: Tokyo Drift, Jarhead) is attached to direct/produce the film and acclaimed animator & music video director Choz Belen (Far East Movement's "I Party" and Deep Foundation's "Sleep") is set to animate the film. The film will be voiced by Karin Anna Cheung (The People I've Slept With, Better Luck Tomorrow) and Daisuke Suzuki (American Dad!, The Hillz).
Principal photography is expected to commence early February 2011 in the Los Angeles and New York area, and post production/illustrations will commence shortly afterwards.
This film is inspired to bring awareness to the Hiroshima & Nagasaki bombings in hopes that nothing like this will ever happen again and over time, show tremendous forgiveness after these terrible incidents occurred. This project will commemorate the 66th Anniversary of the bombings and is dedicated to the Association of Hiroshima & Nagasaki A-bomb Survivors.
We are in the process of setting up an IMDB page once production starts rolling, so hopefully everything is squared away by then!
What the money is for: In the past several months, the crew has grown and managing the project has happily taken over our lives. This critical mass is forcing us to leave our part time work and focus on the film until it is done. The funds needed would be directed straight to the production and animation costs as well as distribution and the film festival budget. Your financial support will make this a reality.
Plus, you'll have the satisfaction of knowing that you were able to contribute to a life-long dream. Mrs. Suyeishi always wanted a biopic to be filmed of her story before she passed away, and to see it come true would make her very happy.
HIBAKUSHA CAST AND CREW
STARRING: KAZ SUYEISHI, PRISCILLA GEE, DAISUKE SUZUKI, KARIN ANNA CHEUNG
DIRECTOR(S): STEVE NGUYEN & CHOZ BELEN

Choz and Steve have been diligently working to stay on top of our production agenda to get a rough cut done before mid-June. So far, we're about 99.9999% completed with principal photography and the recordings and we've managed to wrap up production in January 2012. The cast & crew were amazing!

campaign.story:
MELODY AND THE OLD SOCK is a dark fantasy that follows a young woman named Melody as she comes to terms with the worst night of her life. With her trusty companion Old Sock by her side, she deals with the nightmare in her own unique way. Our film combines old school camera techniques with high production values in a story that will, dare we say it, blow your mind.  We're aiming for a Sundance festival premiere.
WHAT WE'RE DOING We’re raising money to resume production and finish our film. Though we planned carefully, we were taken off guard by the actual cost of shooting our exterior scenes at night, in the woods, with a large crew. Moving into interiors, we realize that we need the support of beautiful people like you to make this thing happen.
WHY WE'RE DOING IT A solid film starts with a solid story. This weird little monster of a script was so well received, by men and women alike, that we chose it to be the first Atomic Puppy Studios film. As you can see by the dailies in the video above, every department has brought a level of excellence that transcends our budget limitations, all for the love of the art, and the opportunity to collaborate and create something truly different and special. Your generous support will give us the resources we need to finish what we started, and validate the hard work and dedication of our tireless talent and crew.
WHAT IS KICKSTARTER? Kickstarter uses the "crowdfunding" concept to enable the many to reach the few. Even if you can't contribute much, your money goes really far when enough people get involved. Folks who contribute a bit more get some pretty nice incentives for being awesome, supporting the arts, and truly making a difference through direct involvement with artists like us :)
EVERY LITTLE BIT HELPS. We have a lot to raise in a short period of time. If you know others who dig weird, wonderful, dark stuff, please let them know about us. Thank you so much!
THE INCENTIVES are cascading. You get everything from the lower donor tiers when you donate to the project at a particular level.
That means, for example, that for $100.00, you get your name on the website, a PDF of the final shooting script, an electronic press kit, a hard copy of the shooting script with director’s notes and shot sheets, your freakin' name in the end credits, an autographed photo, a signed poster, a DVD, and a limited edition T-Shirt. That's a big whoppin' pile of sweet swag, in addition to being a patron of the arts and an all around fabulous person. And you ARE fabulous, but then, you probably already knew that.
Image by Alatus Photography
---------------------- FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS ----------------------
WHAT WILL YOU DO WITH THE FINISHED FILM? Exhibit at major U.S. and international film festivals.
WHAT IF YOU DON'T HIT THE KICKSTARTER GOAL BY THE DEADLINE? When you contribute, Kickstarter holds the funds in escrow until the target date. If we don’t hit our goal by then, Kickstarter returns the money, the production gets nothing, and we’re back to square one with no cash at all. Yikes.
WHAT IF YOU RAISE MORE MONEY THEN YOU'RE ASKING FOR? That would be amazing. The more we raise, the stronger the film becomes, as every dime will be spent on production. A few projects on Kickstarter have blown out their goals considerably. We’d love to be in their company.
CAN I INCREASE MY PLEDGE ONCE IT'S BEEN MADE? You bet! Just sign in and click the “Manage Your Donation” button to enter a new amount, or choose a new incentive.
IS $10,000 THE ENTIRE BUDGET? Oh, heavens no. This is the amount we need to finish shooting.
WHEN DO INCENTIVES GO OUT? Incentives will be sent after we wrap in March. We’ll contact you to get info like T-Shirt size and whatnot.
WHAT IF I DON'T CARE ABOUT THE INCENTIVES? Just click the button that lets you opt out.
WHERE CAN I LEARN MORE ABOUT THE FILM? Check out: www.melodymovie.com www.facebook.com/melodymovie www.youtube.com/melodymovie http://www.cinefile.com/scott/
Questions? Comments? Email us: melodymovie@atomicpuppystudios.com

updates.update_userinfo: Editing again! An update for backers only.
updates.update_content:
Melody and the Old Sock's progress in post has been a little slow, but we're doing some retooling, and now that the holidays are over we're back in the editing suite, with post producer Joel Sacramento on point. I greatly appreciate the emails, calls, texts, naughty phone-camera pics, and the occasional surprise influx of cash (thank you, Stephen D) expressing continued support for the project.  This stuff is mighty helpful for keeping up my Pollyanna-like demeanor when challenges arise.  
There's a recent blog entry on my sporadic Melody production blog featuring our talented producer Katharin Mraz, whose company Ladie K Productions, Inc is "in association with" FMM and Atomic Puppy to make the film.  Check it out at www.cinefile.com/scott.  She makes being a workaholic look good!

Hi Folks,
Terry Jun (Co-Creator/Exec Producer/DP/Visual Effects Supervisor) reminded me that there hasn’t been a progress report in quite some time.  My bad.  Here’s the short version:
Our new editor Mariia Wiemken is currently in Moscow, playing around with the Melody footage while editing for a successful TV series.  Michelle Gajus is working on some interesting ideas for an evocative credit sequence.  Illustrator Justin Chung just finished a book for Marvel, and is working on a kickin' one-sheet design.

As many of you know, we have wrapped shooting on Melody and the Old Sock, aside from a day's worth of pick-ups, which I'm determining now as I go through the footage.  The machinery has been set in motion to get your Kickstarter incentives out to you, though it'll be a short while on that; we'll keep you posted.
I've attached 3 screen captures that correlate to the storyboard in Update #5, to give you an idea of how we went with that scene.  There were 2 notable changes from the way the shot was originally planned:  Delaney (DP) and Mike (AC) employed a "slider," which is basically a heavy-duty tripod-mounted dolly, to push in on Karisa (Melody) during the scene to add emotional impact.  Also, the blood drips in the sink never looked quite right, so Karisa suggested the blood smear, which worked like a charm.

3/26 12:10 AM
We resume shooting in a few hours, thanks to all of you!  It's midnight, so I should get some sleep.  Before I do that, here's the first shot of the second round of shooting for your perusal.
Our D.P. Lane drew the storyboards.  We're scheduled to spend two hours on this shot, from 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM central time: an hour to block, frame, and light it, and another hour to rehearse both performance and camera movement.  I'd like to say we won't need that much time, but who can say?

Hi, gang
Thanks to all of you, and a couple of generous donors who chose to give cash instead of put it on their cards (Thank you, Allan and Charles!), we made our goal!
We resume shooting next weekend.
Booya.

ASSOCIATE PRODUCER SCREEN CREDIT IS NOW AT THE $125.00 LEVEL*
CO-EXECUTIVE PRODUCER SCREEN CREDIT IS NOW AT THE $499.00 LEVEL
COME ONE, COME ALL!  TELL IT ON THE MOUNTAIN!
* * * * * * * * * *
Soon after we wrapped exteriors in the fall, Nelson Carvajal from www.cinefile.com interviewed us about our experience.

updates.update_userinfo: Check out our Cinefile Crew Interview
updates.update_content:
Last night, before I hit the jolly, candy-like green button that officially launched the project, my heart kinda leapt into my throat, and I hesitated for a moment...
What if people just don't get what we're doing? What if our pitch misses the mark? What if our crew, friends and family don't share the link, and this page is a ghost town? Those thoughts were way spookier than anything we're shooting in March; and folks, I gotta tell ya, some of what we're shooting in March is pretty freakin' spooky. But I digress...
So anyway, as I write this we're just one day in, and at $1350.00, we're 13.5 percent funded. Glory be. We have just 11 backers at this very early stage of the game: a party mix of friends, family, and (the true test) a couple of Kickstarter-browsin' cats who just dig what we're doing. It's a good start. I do believe I can sleep tonight.

campaign.story:
Many people believed for a time that the art of stop-motion animation was dead (or at least in critical condition). Tim Burton's love of the art form helped change that. This is our chance to thank him! This project is a full-on stop-motion animated short film that I have been developing for over a year, and it's ready to begin.
The film is beautifully narrated by none other than Sir Christopher Lee! Generous and gracious, he supported the idea and agreed to be a part of this very special tribute.
The money raised through Kickstarter will be used to create the sculptures, armatures, molds and finish the stop-motion puppets, in addition to the rapid prototyping / 3D printing of several components. Many other production and post-production elements will be required including some visual effects, compositing, motion control shots, sound design and of course original music. In order for the film to be able to screen theatrically, it will need to be finished in high resolution. As such, there will be some hardware and software necessities.
I invite you to visit www.wondermotionstudios.com for more information. This will be the place where you can get an exclusive inside look at the behind-the-scenes "making of". We will feature regular video posts and I promise you this will be a fun project to follow! For you hardcore stop-motion enthusiasts, we'll have some instructional video posts as well and may even tip a trade secret or two. Whether you're a newbie or a pro, there will be something to learn, so you'll want to tune in to that!
On behalf of myself, and my amazing team, we are profoundly grateful to have our shot and can't wait to start. But it really starts with you! None of it will be possible without your help and support!

campaign.story:
THE FILM
SYNOPSIS In the near future during the bleak winter of 2015 mankind is discovering that the mind is evolving... people are experiencing and manipulating their realities through a communal shared consciousness.
Will Kent awakes on a train headed upstate New York to his hometown of Croton Falls. After his fiancé leaves him and his writing career tailspins he leaves New York City to reconcile with his emotions and restore some sense of purpose to his life. But after reconnecting with his parents and some old friends he finds his reality slowly unraveling blurring the lines between the real and the imaginary.
And as Will fights to hold on to his sanity a disturbing truth begins to emerge.
A BIT MORE... This 15-minute short film explores several topics having elements of science fiction, drama, insanity and fear. At the forefront is the bleak depiction of a near, post-2012 future where the mind is evolving but society is beginning to crumble. At the core is much more personal story of a man looking to escape the fears and anxieties of his life, his relationships, and his responsibilities as an adult. But he soon realizes that we cannot escape the consequences of the choices we make.
This short story is also an ancillary piece to a much larger tale. We hope this short film will generate enough momentum to continue to develop the full-length feature story.
PROJECT LOCATION New York, NY Putnam and Westchester County, NY
YOUR DONATIONS
WHAT IS THE MONEY FOR / WHO DOES IT GO TO? Every dollar of your contribution goes towards the production and development of this film. Film productions are expensive. Your donations will go towards helping fund the equipment, cast, crew and general costs of putting a production together. The better product we can create, the better outreach and response we can achieve.
IS MY PLEDGE PUBLICLY DISPLAYED? Nope. Your pledge is kept between you and the project creator.
CAN I INCREASE MY PLEDGE? Sure! Once you sign back into www.kickstarter.com simply return to our campaign page and click on "Manage Your Donation". There you can enter a new amount or choose a different incentive.
CAN WE EXCEED OUR GOAL? We sure can. Every single dollar will help make this a better film! Our goal is to exceed our goal!
I'M NOT IN THE US. CAN I STILL PLEDGE? Yep. You can pledge from anywhere in the world.
WHAT HAPPENS IF THE MONEY ISN'T RAISED IN TIME? If our goal isn’t met before the deadline, we don't receive any of the pledges and your credit or debit card will not be charged.
INCENTIVES
WHEN WILL YOU GET YOUR INCENTIVE? Once we reach our goal we still have a long road ahead of us including filming, post-production, soundtrack recording, festival submissions, etc. but we will make sure to be as diligent as possible in getting you your incentives!
WHAT IF I DON'T WANT THE INCENTIVE If you simply want to donate and do not want the incentive you can just opt out of receiving it.
HOW CAN I LEARN MORE MORE ABOUT THE PROJECT
CONTACT US Email crotonfallsfilm@gmail.com for general information about the project and to get into direct contact with the director Joseph Marconi.
AFTERWARD After production is completed we will begin an aggressive festival submission campaign. We have our fingers crossed for Sundance 2012.
We hope you will be part of this journey.
Sincerely, Joseph Marconi

campaign.story:
Hi! Thanks for checking out our project, "The Perks of Writing a Musical." With your help, we would like to make our vision a realilty and launch one of the most ambitious web shows on the Internet. "The Perks of Writing a Musical" is a new scripted musical web show. Glee meets Wii.
I'm very excited to be working on a web show. Web shows have been called the last great entertainment frontier of our lifetime - a Wild West of Possibilities! You can help us make "The Perks of Writing a Musical" a possibility.
"The Perks of Writing a Musical" is an up-beat, feel-good musical to cheer us up during down-turned times. We want your support to create a show filled with charming characters, wonderful stories, great acting, first-rate production values - including an amazing musical video. It's the kind of show they'll be talking about at the virtual water cooler for years to come.
"The Perks of Writing a Musical" is about the youthful world of teen-aged gamers, what makes them play, love, and create. It's about the challenges of true intimacy in a tech-driven world and and the transformative nature of art.
We've drawn our creative team from Hollywood's independent film world and the Broadway community. Creator Tom Diggs' work was recently nominated for the Pulitzer Prize for Drama. Director Bill Oliver is AFI alum and has worked for Paramount and SONY. Cinematographer David Kagen comes to us from True Blood, Entourage and The Green Hornet. Composer Jason Michael Snow is currently in the Book of Mormom on Broadway. Lyricist Misha Faucher is a favorite at the prestigious BMI Musical Theatre Workshop where she and Jason often collaborate. And we've cast an amazing, charismatic group of actor-singers - including Alex Wyse, Allison Strong, and Paul Cereghino - check them out in our video. In the end, we're just a crew of indie creative types who like to create cool stuff. We believe this is going to be a great musical web show!
So here's where you come in. We're raising money to produce the kind of pilot episode the world can't help but fall in love with. We were originally going to shoot it all guerilla style with iphones and Flip cameras, but the musical production number renders that impossible. Everyone above the line (directors, actors, writers) is donating their time and talent. However, "below the line" production costs (including pre- and post-) aren't donated as easily. Still, we have been able to slash a $50,000 budget down to a workable $12,000 to create the best production possible.
OUR PROMISE: Principal Casting completed: Feb. 15, 2011 Song recorded: Feb. 20, 2011 Shooting wrapped: March 27, 2011 Launched by May 15, 2011. We're registered to launch on blip.tv, youtube, as well as www.theperksofwritingamusical.com
Everyone who donates at least $10 gets a shooting script of the pilot episode signed by the cast and creative team. $25 dollars gets you a CD of the pilot episode song, "She Doesn't Know My Name," also signed. Every cent donated will go into the budget of the pilot. With your support, you will not just receive premiums signed by tomorrow's rising stars, but you'll also be inspiring a community of artists and you'll be a vital part of the next generation of musicals.
Thank you for your support!

campaign.story:
The purpose of the project is to create a socially relevant short film that pushes the boundary of modern film conventions while communicating the importance of human interaction.
In the screenplay, the main character, Gerson, has narrowly escaped a failed International Space Agency mission. Thought to be dead with the rest of the crew, he is the sole survivor. We meet Gerson 3 years into his 8 year journey home. Confined to small space that is his escape pod, and no way of communicating with Earth, Gerson’s only interactions are with the pod’s caring, yet nagging Artificial Intelligence mechanism, Xie Xie. Over the years they have developed a personal relation and have fallen in love.
We have a renowned set builder signed on to create the escape pod on a UCLA sound stage. We are scheduled to shoot for 4 days, and have a top notch cast and crew in place.
In order to ensure successful production and completion, we need extra funding for special effects personnel, catering, raw film stock and processing, post-production costs, transportation and wardrobe.

campaign.story:
**UPDATE**
We made our goal!! Thank you so much! You still have time to donate and help us cover the fees that Kickstarter and Amazon will collect from us.  If we hit $20K we will perform a special "Men In "Drag" video!
***REWARD UPDATE ($50 or higher)***
A DVD copy (signed by actress Jenn Dees and myself) of WHAT'S UP LOVELY (in addition to the rewards already listed)
***REWARD UPDATE (any amount)***
As a special incentive, we are starting a new game that involves anyone who pledges.  If you donate any amount, we will ask you to give us a single word of your choice -- any word at all. 
At the very end of this campaign, we will take the list of compiled words from all our backers and Joe Schermann will use them all to create lyrics for a song that our actors (including Christina Rose, Debbie Williams...and maybe me!) will perform.  That's right....he'll have to use each and every word you give him. 
Check out the running list of compiled words here
Thanks so much for your continued support!
Gary King (Writer/Director)
***Any Backer from our previous campaign who pledges to this one will have both donations combined in order to receive the larger "thank you" reward***
HOW DO YOU WRITE A JOE SCHERMANN SONG http://www.JoeSchermannSong.com
View this KICKSTARTER video on Vimeo 
Share our KICKSTARTER link: http://kck.st/fOC3Hj
How Do You Write a Joe Schermann Song is a new feature film musical that is currently in post-production.
Thanks to our wonderful Kickstarter backers we were able to shoot our feature film musical this past summer and have been editing the movie ever since.  I am extremely excited to share that test screenings have been positive with great constructive feedback.  Everyone involved with the project is proud that the film has generated great praise for the incredible singing, dancing and acting.
We will soon be moving into the realm of scoring and sound work.  This stage of post-production is where the experts really give the film its final polish. 
We are seeking finishing funds to help us in the following areas:
- live orchestration for the score
- post-production house services for sound design, sound editing and final mixing
- DVD duplications for screeners
- Film Festival fees
Our Kickstarter video details how integral having live orchestrations are for a musical film.  I've also included exclusive sneak peeks to some of the songs from the film to wet your appetite with.  Words cannot express how much having this element added to the film will bring this film to life.  Having the sound elements worked on by a professional post-production facility will ensure the quality of the film is maintained -- so that audiences will be immersed into the full experience of the film.
Please check out the right hand side of this page to review all the rewards available. We are truly grateful for any amount you are able to donate.  And remember your pledge will not be carried through unless we meet our goal of raising a minimum of $18,000 by April 30th, 2011. 
***Any Backer from our previous campaign who pledges to this one will have both donations combined in order to receive the larger "thank you" reward***
If we don't reach that amount by the deadline we do not receive any of it. Every little bit helps and goes a long way. From a donation to simply just letting your friends know about this campaign via word-of-mouth to Facebook and Twitter, it all means a lot to us. With your belief in us I know we can do it.
Kickstarter has been nothing but amazing to our film and to the indie film community.  Since our previous campaign, I have really enjoyed donating to other crowdfunding projects and continue to do so whenever possible.  It is what's keeping the dream alive for many artists. 
Thank you for your continued love and support for me and everyone involved with this project.  We sincerely mean it when we say we couldn't do it without you.  It was so inspiring to begin it all with Kickstarter and our amazing backers - it will be only fitting to close out this chapter with this campaign as we bring our film to completion.
Gary King (Writer/Director) on behalf of the "SCHERMANN SONG" Cast and Crew 
Film Synopsis: Joe and his girlfriend Evey dream of hitting it big on Broadway. When Joe lands an opportunity to write for an Off-Broadway musical, he is forced to cast either the love of his life or Summer, his newly discovered muse. The realities of show business prove to Joe that writing is easy, living is hard.

updates.update_content:
Hello Wonderful Backers!
A quick update to let you know that the "Special Features" content has been completed for the Blu-Ray special edition. Shortly we'll be sending it to our manufacturer in Denver (thanks to filmmaker Hunter Weeks for his referral). They will be authoring a master copy and sending it to us for review. Once all that is done we will have them press the copies and ship them to me. We're almost there so I really appreciate your patience. (And fear not, if you don't want a blu-ray disc I'll make you a DVD or send you a digital copy). I'll be in touch soon (approx mid Jan) to confirm everyone's shipping address and thank you gifts.

Hi everyone
Greetings!! I hope this finds you well. I have some very exciting news to share with you (if you haven't already heard about it from my cast and myself on Facebook and Twitter).
How Do You Write A Joe Schermann Song has been shortlisted for IFP's Gotham Audience Award!!  Simply put they are like the Oscars for independent film selected by distinguished juries, presented in New York City, the home of independent film, & are the first honors of the film awards season.

Just wanted to share with you our latest screening updates:
First off our huge announcement is we are beginning our theatrical screenings with our NYC Premiere on November 1st (Thurs) at 7:30pm at the Landmark Sunshine Theaters! I'll be there with the entire cast (Joe Schermann, Christina Rose, Mark DiConzo, Debbie Williams, Daryl Ray Carliles) and composer Ken Lampl for a Q&A after the screening. We'll also have some free giveaways as well.

updates.update_userinfo: "Schermann Song" Short Listed for Gothams (we need your help)
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone
I have some great updates to share with you.  First and foremost thank you again for your support and belief in our film.  I'm in the middle of editing the "behind-the-scenes" footage and we plan to finalize the Special Edition DVD for everyone very soon.  We plan to place our bulk order in the very early Summer and as soon as we get them we will start shipping them out along with your other rewards!

Hello wonderful backers!!
Great news!!  One of our very first screenings of "How Do You Write A Joe Schermann Song" will be at the Phoenix Film Festival this week!!  We're screening from Friday (3/30) through Sun (4/1)!  The cast/crew and I are so excited! 
Here's a video with more info on who will be attending and what goodies we're bringing with us!  We hope to see you there!!

Hey everyone
We've just released our official trailer!  check it out here:
We're excited for the film festival interest we've already received and can't wait to share our screening news as soon as we're allowed to make it public! 

In the meantime we've ordered our posters and are finalizing our official soundtrack for both CD and digital download.  We are about 1/2 way through editing all our special features "behind the scenes" footage for the special edition DVD.

Please post this trailer on your FB or twitter page as we'd love to have as many eyeballs on it as possible.  That way we can get more festival interest and bring the film to your town.  I'd love for you to see the film with an audience!

Thank you again for all your tremendous generosity and support!
Gary

campaign.story:
Thank you for stopping by! The Split Strap project was successfully funded on Kickstarter. Come visit us at CustomSLR.com to check out our latest news, updates and products.
Hello there! Thank you for stopping by our project. With your support, we hope to distribute a better carrying experience to as many people possible worldwide and even create a new standard in carrying strap comfort!
We were inspired to improve poorly designed straps that fail to address the basic anatomical needs of our bodies. Most straps are uncomfortable since they do not distribute weight effectively.
Split Strap is our patent pending solution to this conundrum. We engineered the Split Strap concept from the ground up while integrating as many favorable features as possible by using data we collected from research on the human anatomy.
The Split Strap is designed and developed with maximum ergonomics and comfort in mind.
After studying how straps interact with the structures of the shoulder, neck, and back, we discovered that the planar/flat profiled nature of existing straps did not contour to the body well causing unequal weight/force distribution, discomfort and possible strain.
Our breakthrough design utilizes a split in the strap which creates multiple points where the strap could sit and conform to the body; thus, distributing the weight evenly and increasing comfort. The split also promotes cooling by venting heat away.
On the backside of the strap, we integrated sticky silicone printed logos that reduce annoying slippage.
The rotating quick release buckle reduces strap tension by pivoting with the movements of the user, which decreases chaffing and increases slack to facilitate further flexibility and comfort.
We hope to have the Split Straps for the various applications available by mid-March. The Kickstarter pre-order prices include shipping in the US and is lower than the expected retail price.
Thank you for your support!
How do I pre-order more than 1 strap? If you would like to order more than one strap simply choose a pledging option and add the extra amount. For example, if you want one camera strap and one arm sling, the total will be $22 + $30 for a total pledge amount of $52. All straps will come complete. So if you order two you will be receiving two complete straps (not just additional attachments).
I don't live in the US. How do I add additional shipping? The extra shipping fees are $3 for Canada and $8 for International - simply add this amount to your pledge amount. _________________________________________
Here are the Split Straps that will be available.
Gliding Split Strap for Cameras The gliding Split Strap is designed to make it easy to draw the camera from your side. The camera glides up the strap so your are ready to shoot quickly. This straps works with the Custom SLR C-Loop, traditional strap mounting points and most camera sling systems.
Split Strap for Cameras The Split Strap for cameras is a direct replacement for camera straps. The ends are fully adjustable in length and complements the Custom SLR C-Loop and works with traditional camera strap mounting points.
Split Strap for Laptop, Messenger and Smaller Bags Designed for laptop and smaller bags. Great for carrying your laptop to work or hauling your camera bag around. To use the split strap for your bag application, you will need to make sure that your bag has removable straps.
Split Strap for Guitars The Split Strap for guitars is designed to work with acoustic and electric guitars.
Split Strap Arm Sling Have an injured arm? Spare yourself the strain of traditional non-padded arm sling straps that dig into your shoulder and neck.
Split Strap for Duffel, Sports and Larger Bags Designed to work with duffel and larger carry-on size bags. Perfect for travelers. To use the split strap for your bag application, you will need to make sure that your bag has removable straps.

Our passion to innovate and create products that improve the shooting experience hasn't stopped. The Split Strap design has been deployed successfully in the photography space as well as other applications including medical and music. campaign.story:
A BIG Thank You to everyone who has contributed! We're very grateful. And of course exceeding our goal would allow us to provide even deeper and broader coverage of art's history!
WHAT IS SMARTHISTORY? Smarthistory.org is a Webby-award winning, free and open educational resource for the study of art history. Smarthistory was created by two art historians, Beth Harris and Steven Zucker, each with twenty years of teaching experience, who saw an opportunity to use conversation and the web to make art history accessible to their students. The Smarthistory website currently covers more than 300 works of art and is fast becoming a viable alternative to the commercial textbook. Visit Smarthistory.org. WHO USES SMARTHISTORY, AND WHY In 2010, Smarthistory.org was visited more than half a million times by visitors from more than 150 countries. Nearly one hundred universities, libraries and museums now recommend Smarthistory and instructors are increasingly adopting it in place of the expensive survey textbook. Even if you’re not a college student, Smarthistory is a great resource, and we want to keep it that way. WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP We have so much great content -- but we need to create at least 100 more videos in order for Smarthistory to be a truly viable alternative to the survey textbook. Every $100 contribution from you makes one more video possible. And because Smarthistory.org is a 501(c)3 organization, your contribution may also be tax-deductible (please consult your tax advisor). WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING ABOUT SMARTHISTORY Some recent press... Brainpickings Democratizing Art History. Traditionally, the study of art history has belonged to the privileged. Tuition-rich courses, overpriced textbooks, trips to museums (often across vast oceans) — they all cost a pretty penny. [...]Smarthistory is perhaps the most centralized effort to make art history an accessible field. The Huffington Post Given the efficiency of the site's schematic and the wellspring of accurate and interesting information it provides, it's easy to understand why Smarthistory.org is rapidly becoming a favorite of would-be art historians on college campuses everywhere. Chronicle of Higher Education Smarthistory, begun in 2005, gets about 65,000 visits a month, up about 60 percent over last year. It won the Webby award for best education Web site in 2009. It has been used or recommended by dozens of colleges, including Princeton, the University of Texas at Austin, and Vassar. See what people are saying about Smarthistory on Twitter Watch our five-word acceptance speech at the 2009 Webby Awards WHAT YOU CAN DO 1) Make a tax-deductible donation to Smarthistory, a 501(c)3 organization, and get some fantastic gifts in return (please consult your tax advisor to determine the tax deductibility of your gift) 2) Use Twitter, Facebook, and other social media networks to spread the word about our campaign 3) Write a blog post about us 4) Interview us for your blog Visit Smarthistory.org.

Huge thanks to all of our amazing contributors. Your dedication, support and excitement has meant the world to us. Kickstarter has shown us that there is a real community of support for our work and for Open Education in general. This is enormously gratifying. Thank you. We feel honored and very very lucky.

updates.update_userinfo: This Project Update Is About You!
updates.update_content: You've already contributed to the Smarthistory Kickstarter drive (and we hope you know how enormously appreciative we are). You've spent time on the Smarthistory.org site, reading, watching, exploring. You are our ideal viewer—thoughtful, curious, and committed. Now we want to ask one more thing of you. Tell us about your Smarthistory experience. We want to learn what you found on the site that made you a supporter. Has it changed the way you think about art in some way? Has it helped enrich your experience? Did it prompt a conversation? Please tell us what Smarthistory means to you in the comments area below. We are so interested, please take a moment and let us learn from you.

updates.update_userinfo: FCC (Federal Communications Commission) Blog Cites Smarthistory In Post On National Learning Registry
updates.update_content:
The project website for this important initiative just went live and we are very excited that Smarthistory was cited in the post which stated,
"We hope to see more innovation like smarthistory.org, a free and open, conversation-based multimedia art history web-book. Smarthistory.org aggregates our cultural treasures—digitally—but also encourages the learner to engage and analyze in real time, engaging students in a whole new way."

Today marks the mid-point of our crowdsourcing experiment in fundraising here on Kickstarter and we thought that was a good opportunity for an update.
We are hearing from new teachers nearly every week who are adopting Smarthistory.org and in the past 31 days (January 13 to February 12), the site was visited 81,684 times by people in 154 countries. The map below shows the percentage of new visitors around the world during the past month (darker = a higher percentage). Free and open education works thanks to you.

campaign.story:
We are developing Protei : a low-cost open-source oil collecting robot that autonomously sails upwind, intercepting oil sheens going downwind. Protei combines conventional technologies in an innovative design that we can implement in the short term to address timely environmental crisis such as the BP Oil Spill, cleaning the ocean gyre garbage patches or performing ocean research. We need your help to build our next prototype of Protei - the first articulated sailing boat that can tack upwind pulling a long heavy payload and initiating a revolutionary family in ocean robotics. http://protei.org 
A situation we must change 
Current Oil spill skimming technology was able to collect only 3% of the BP Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill. The health of remediation workers was compromised by exposure to cancerous toxic chemicals, skimming boats themselves contributed to pollution and were expensive to power, operations were constrained by daily weather conditions and were limited by proximity to the coast. In contrast, Protei aims to be : unmanned, unrestrained by human biological needs; green and affordable; self-righting and therefore operable even in hurricane conditions; semi-autonomous, so that far offshore, many Protei would be able to intelligently and continuously swarm.
Observations and ideas from testing 
 Spilled oil moves downwind from its source following surface currents. Traditional oil skimmers pull oil-absorbent booms and trace random linear paths in a sea of oil. But a better way to capture this oil is to sail upwind, intercepting the oil sheens traveling downwind. Protei harnesses the wind in order to power an unmanned sailing drone, pulling a long oil-absorbent ‘tail’ upwind. A fleet of many Protei will work automatically as a swarm, or be remotely controlled by coastal residents and on-line gamers.
When you pull a long heavy object behind a traditional sailboat, the center of gravity is altered such that in order to preserve navigability it becomes necessary to redesign the relationship of hull, keel, and rudder. The solution we found is to design an entirely articulated sailing boat that curves when it tacks upwind. Building and testing consecutive prototypes with multiple sails, we soon realized that Protei's hull bending would expose both sides of the vessel to the wind when tacking upwind, continuously catching wind with the different sails, increasing power and control - and creating a totally new way of sailing! We also found out that an inflatable body would make Protei featherweight for a very large sail surface : an excellent power ratio. Inflatable means also cheaper and collision-safe. Version after version, we keep improving the design and discovering new properties. 
Versions  
 - Protei_001 : front steering, Remote Controlled. 
 - Protei_002 : articulated sailboat, Remote Controlled. 
 - Protei_003 : articulated inflatable sailboat, lightweight and larger sail surface, good power ratio. - Protei_004 : electric, swarm for display, art. 
 - Protei_005 : electronic, on-board sensors and micro-chip control, wireless real-time communication and monitored with webcam to analyze trajectory. 
What the money is for   
- Protei_006 : We need money to build our next prototype at full scale to measure the performances : * how much oil can be absorbed. * how much floating plastic debris we can collect from the ocean garbage patches. * how much weight of scientific payload we can transport for ocean studies and exploration. This next prototype will be packed with electronics and sensors: micro-controllers, GPS, long range wireless communication, solar panel, wind turbine, accelerometers, anemometer, pressure gauges, batteries, servo/step motors, winches etc. Many of us will gather 3 months this summer in Rotterdam (Netherlands) to build our next prototype and publish the full online documentation so others can build their own versions too. 
Deploy 
Oil spills are happening all the time across the world. In many of these locations, access to effective yet inexpensive remediation technology is lacking. Thus, Protei is Open Hardware so anyone can use, modify, and distribute Protei. Currently Protei is being developed as a team effort by Open_Sailing in the UK and France, V2_ in the Netherlands, randomwalks in South Korea, Amorphica in the US and Mexico and contributors from all around the world. If you cannot back us, you can work with us :)
Protei is the plural for Proteus, Greek sea-god and son of Poseidon. Proteus was known for his mutability, his capability of assuming many forms. The word protean evokes flexibility, versatility and adaptability. The machine we are developing now is Protei for collecting spilled oil at sea, but being an open source project, other versions may be designed in the future for other purposes : to harvest the Great Pacific Garbage Patch, to capture heavy metal pollutants in coastal areas, extract toxic contaminants from urban waterways, perform oceanographic research, monitor marine life etc.
We hope that developing Protei Open Hardware will contribute to ocean studies and pollution remediation. Help us build our next prototype. Thank you!
Share our website: https://sites.google.com/a/opensailing.net/protei/ Our video : http://www.youtube.com/watch... Our Vimeo : http://www.vimeo.com/20434995 We're also on Good.is : http://www.good.is/post/protei-an-open-source-fleet-of-oil-spill-cleaning-robot-drones/ and Hackaday : http://hackaday.com/2011/03/12/protei-articulated-backward-sailing-robots-clean-oil-spills/

updates.update_userinfo: Quiet launch of Protei as a commercial prototype
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers, 
Last time we sent you an update, it was to share with you some amazing adventures we had sailing around the world to meet the Protei community and immerse ourselves in several ocean issues (plastic pollution in Hawaii, Radioactivity in Fukushima Japan, pollution in China and India, Oil pollution in Ghana etc). We also announced that we are moving to Hong Kong. And we did. We have been in Hong Kong for 8 months now, and a few weeks ago we have finished building with our own hands our new office, and a new workshop for Protei.

updates.update_userinfo: Protei sailing around the world for 4 months
updates.update_content: You have not heard from us for a long time, in large part because Cesar Harada and Gabriella Levine  have been at sea for the last 4 months. We have just circumnavigated the whole world, leaving from San Diego for Ensenada Mexico, Hilo Hawaii, Fukushima Japan, Hong Kong China, Ho Chi Minh City Vietnam, Singapore, Rangoon Burma, Cochin India, Port Louis Mauritius, Cape Town South Africa, Accra Ghana, Casablanca Morocco and finally Barcelona Spain. If you want to read the full report, you can go here!

We're coming back to you with a bag of big news about Protei and the progress of the Protei team. 
Protei at Techshop San Francisco, Summer 2012. Mad scientist look ∑8D !

updates.update_userinfo: 20120524 Ars Electronica, DEAF and Stanford Survey
updates.update_content:

I hope this update finds you healthy and happy. Summer is coming, and a lot is happening for Protei.
--
Ars Electronica

Dear Backers, 
Long time without updates, my apologies. We've been working hard developing Protei legal infrastructure in the UK and in the USA, and most importantly getting closer to "Protei 1 Meter Remote Control" as "a product" for our dear backers :) 
I am glad to present to you today Protei_008b, last born and tested a few weeks ago in Long Beach California. Video on youtube + vimeo + Flickr + orginal file

updates.update_userinfo: With Naomi Klein and recruiting a project manager assistant
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers, 
Christmas is approaching and we are not forgetting you :) We may contact some of you soon to deliver you christmas surprises / rewards :)
I just wanted to share with you a recent article in the Huffington Post that featured Protei right after Naomi Klein's TED Talk "Addicted to Risk", a great honour for us to follow such a brilliant person. Klein comments on the BP oil spill and our addiction to risk and suggests ways to invent our future, this is a talk worth seeing.

updates.update_userinfo: Protei in Ireland, Spain, Japan, in the media.
updates.update_content:
Dear backers, 
You have not heard form us in a while - but we have not forgotten you at all! The opposite! We have been working very hard and recovering from this summer work in Rotterdam and we are hitting the road - literally.

Ladies and Gentlemen, 
Please welcome Fiona Crabbie, our naval Architect. 
Protei World Premiere

Happy friday dear backers!
We have it! We've been restless working on the draft of our handbook, the publication that goes along our latest prototype, Protei_006. This 100 pages book, richly illustrated, explains the motivation, design process, how the concept evolved into our current design, and of course, the future Protei technology.
But you would expect this from us : we want your feedback. You made this project possible, tell us what you think, help us make a better first publication, this is your project. This goes for printing monday morning 9:00 AM Rotterdam time. If you have a little bit of time to spare this week-end, we'll review each of your comments and act upon them. The draft is online and you don't even need to register to comment or write a new paragraph.

Yes! finally we tested Protei with all electronics on board! How exciting this was - the work of the whole team, in one place, on the water. 
We took Protei on the roof of my old van to the most windy end of pier nearby.
